customize.text: Menogias

Yakshas are Adepti, illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected the land since ancient times, along with Rex Lapis and other Adepti. During the Archon War, they fought alongside Morax and were present when Guizhong returned to the elements. It was Yakshas who held back the barrier placed over her to prevent the spread of dark energy. Among all Yakshas, there were five strongest: Bosacius, Alatus, Menogias, Indarias and Bonanus. They became known throughout the world simply as "The Yakshas."

General Kapisas Menogias was one of The Yakshas who protected Liyue. He said that people should live in the present and enjoy every pleasant surprise. Menogias was the creator of many of the costumes for Rex Lapis. Although the Lord of Geo never wore these clothes during the war, he now values them very much. Once he created a suit for Bosacius, but the four-armed Yaksha did not appreciate it, since the suit had only two sleeves. Menogias possessed a singular talent for clothing design. He had an exquisite eye not just for fabric selection and color pairing, but also for what accessories could best accentuate a garment's overall styling. At a gathering of Adepti, Bonanus once complained in secret to some of the ladies in attendance that the skirt Menogias made for her was too long and impractical, lamenting that it would only hinder her in battle. However, when Cloud Retainer asked Menogias his opinion, he remarked that the train of the skirt would serve to enhance Bonanus's Adeptal countenance by exemplifying a certain elegance. When it came to topics relating to garments and accessories, not even Rex Lapis could best his stubbornness.

After the Archon War, the lands of Liyue were plagued by pestilence and famine. The rotting remains of the defeated gods spread across the world, reborn into demons. The monsters' rage manifested in the form of diseases, monster infestations, and other strange occurrences. Then, Rex Lapis summoned the Yakshas to vanquish the demons. They swore an oath: <color=#ffffffd9>"Restore order through slaughter, purge evil through battle. To this, we dedicate our lives."</color> Being the most fierce and warlike of all the Adepti, they were ready to do anything to protect the lands.

For many years, Yakshas faithfully protected Rex Lapis and pacified all manner of catastrophes in the world. But there came a day when they, despite their might, found that their deeds had taken their toll and that the remnants of divine bitterness had begun to poison them. Having fallen under the influence of the hatred of the defeated gods, they became bound by karmic debt. Karmic debt is a kind of poison for Yakshas, their punishment for countless murders; it causes them severe pain, infects their consciousness, and causes anger, pain, and horror. Some descended into a blind rage of a kind that cannot be put into words or were driven by fear to equally indescribable madness. Some turned on and destroyed each other. Some were lost to delusions of the mind.
During the Adepti War, three of The Yakshas succumbed to the influence of the karmic debt. Menogias and Bonanus attacked each other, and Bonanus pierced her brother with a spear.

Every year Lantern Rite is celebrated to honor the defenders of Liyue Harbor, Adepti and Yakshas. On the festival night, people launch Xiao Lanterns into the sky. These lanterns mean: let the flame of virtue spread throughout the world and never go out. The people of Liyue thank the fallen heroes for protecting their home and light lanterns to keep their wandering souls from going astray. Menogias was commemorated during the fourth Lantern Rite that the Traveler and Paimon attended. The main theme of the festival was "Kites," and Menogias's friends, Moon Carver and Mountain Shaper, remembered that he was so skilled in matters of craftsmanship, that kite-making would scarcely prove to be a test of his capabilities. Were he yet amongst the living, he could have opened a kite stall, which would have been an establishment rich not only in profit but also esteem. And if, as in the past, he was unable to involve himself in matters of the mortal realm, Moon Carver and Mountain Shaper could sell the kites in his stead. Thus, talking about how they would celebrate success together in wonderful company with a wine, the Adepti were content with joyful memories and enjoyed the beauty of Liyue Harbor for Menogias.
